free: #e Well, what should I say?
#c 嗯..我要說什麼呢？
#n 故事
#n 故事
#e There is a story told by the elderly people of our Gluban tribe.
#c 有個我們清流部落的族老流傳下來的故事。
#n Gluban「清流部落」。
#e I heard about this story long time ago. It has been almost ten years.
#c 我很久以前聽到這則故事。大約快十年了。
#n hari這裡有「快要/將近」的意思。
#e This elderly has passed away.
#c 這位族老已不在了。
#n alang可以指「部落/地區/國家」。
#n alang可以指「部落/地區/國家」。
#e And the elderlies said it is said that we Seediq people used to live in the so-called Truwan area. It was really so in the past.
#c 然後，族老說，聽說我們賽德克人以前住在所謂的Truwan地區。以前也真的是如此。
#n klaali有「平時」的意思。
#n klaali有「平時」的意思。
#e Usually, we do not know the weather beforehand.
#c 平時，我們不能預先知道天氣。
#n karac可以指「天空」或「天氣」。
#e Sometimes it rains, and sometimes it is fine.
#c 有時下雨有時好天氣。
#n bbrigan「買的東西」或「商店」。bari/baruy「買」。
#n bbrigan「買的東西」或「商店」。bari/baruy「買」。
#e And, in the past, we did not have anything like today’s goods in our Seediq tribe.
#c 而且，以前我們賽德克部落裡，什麼現在的商品都沒有。
#e It was unlike now. Now we go from our tribe to Hori to buy any kind of things.
#c 那不像現在。現在我們從部落到埔里買各種東西。
#n kana so「例如」。
#n kana so「例如」。
#e Thus we simply grew food by ourselves, for example, vegetables, and sweet potatoes.
#c 所以，我們乾脆食物自己種植，例如蔬菜、地瓜等。
#e Then, one... it is said that once, no one knows why, there was a really severe drought that year.
#c 然後，一…聽說有一次，也不知怎麼搞的，那一年有一場嚴重的旱災。
#n mdengu「乾」。
#e It was a really severe drought.
#c 那是非常嚴重的旱災。
#n h<m>uwa ka在這裡是口誤。
#n (ini) huwa ka「沒關係」「不嚴重」。
#n plaale han「起初」。
#n h<m>uwa ka在這裡是口誤。
#n (ini) huwa ka「沒關係」「不嚴重」。
#n plaale han「起初」。
#e At first, it was not serious. About one or two months later, there was still food put in their stockhouse.
#c 起初還不嚴重。約一兩個月過去，他們倉庫裡還有食物。
#n mk-表示累積時間。
#n mk-表示累積時間。
#n uka ba「幾乎已沒有」。
#n uka ba「幾乎已沒有」。
#n irih so「猶如」。
#n irih so「猶如」。
#e Then three months passed. There was almost nothing. In other words, there was no food in the whole Seediq tribe
#c 然後三個月了。幾乎什麼都沒有。也就是說，整個賽德克部落沒有食物。
#e At that time, there was really no food, so hildren were pitiful.
#c 那時候，真的沒有食物，那小孩就可憐了。
#n s-gaalu「令人憐惜」「可憐」。
#n m-gedang「遺失」「迷失」。為死亡的委婉說法。
#n m-gedang「遺失」「迷失」。為死亡的委婉說法。
#e They died first. Each day one passed away. And sometimes two passed away each day.
#c 他們先死亡。每一天一個去世。然後有時候一天兩個去世。
#e Our ancestors thought it could not be like this.
#c 我們的祖先想，這樣怎麼得了。
#n ma uxe nii di 「這樣怎麼得了」。
#n 這裡的ma標記不確定。
#e Let's go move to aother place!
#c 我們搬到另一個地方吧！
#n ha和hae一樣。
#e This is the thought of the ancestor.
#c 這就是祖先的想法。
#n so ki naq「就是這樣」。
#n rudan cbeyo「祖先」。
#n anaq是ani naq的縮略詞。
#n anaq是ani naq的縮略詞。
#e They thought even though there is drought here, maybe there is no drought in another place. Thus, he said, “Let’s migrate to another place.”
#c 他認為即使這裡旱災，另一個地方可能沒有旱災。所以他說「我們遷徙到另一個地方吧」。
#e The elderly in the tribe at that time, they dicussed.
#c 那時候部落的族老，他們討論。
#n 郭老師認為此IU為口誤。
#n 郭老師認為此IU為口誤。
#n 郭老師認為此IU為口誤。
#n 郭老師認為此IU為口誤。
#n tn-alang在地人；tn-sapah家的主人；tn-huri狗主人。
#n tn-alang在地人；tn-sapah家的主人；tn-huri狗主人。
#n m-quri「朝…前進」。
#n m-quri「朝…前進」。
#e They brought all the children and all the tribespeople there and went toward what is now called Truku. In the past, it was called going upward.
#c 他們帶所有小孩和所有那裡的族人前往現在的Truku。以前是說往上方移動。
#e What the ancestor meant, now I think, was to go toward the Suku river. I think this is what ancestors meant.
#c 祖先的意思，現在我看來，是要朝Suku河前進。我想這是祖先當時的意思。
#e Therefore, these people from Truwan, they carried all the children on their back and held and supported all the elderly, and they went toward today’s Truku tribe.
#c 所以，這些來自Truwan的族人，他們背著全部的小孩，扶著全部的老人，朝現今的Truku部落移動。
#e Then, (they) thought, “Where will we arrive?”
#c 然後，（他們）想，「我們會到哪裡？」
#e They walked slowly. At that time, there was barely any food.
#c 他們慢慢地走。當時真的幾乎已經沒有食物。
#e They ate all the fruits from trees they passed on the road.
#c 路上經過的樹的果子他們都吃。
#e At that time, this is a story of long long time ago.
#c 那時候，這口傳故事是則很久很久以前的故事。
#n hayan有「還」「暫且」「事先」事先的意思；hayan na意思類似中文語尾助詞「喔」。
#n cm-camac各種動物。
#n cm-camac各種動物。
#e The storyteller said, at that time, people and all kinds of animals could know each other’s language.
#c （傳述者說）在那個年代裡，人類與各種動物知道對方語言。
#n n-niq-un「要住的地方」。
#n n-niq-un「要住的地方」。
#n kn-bgurah「開墾」。
#n kn-bgurah「開墾」。
#e Thus, on their way to find a new place to live, to go and reclaim a land, (they) consulted with fowls and beasts.
#c 所以在他們找要居住之地的路上、去開墾新地時，（他們）向飛禽走獸們請益。
#e “What happened to you? Where are you going?” (they) said.
#c 「你們怎麼了？你們要去哪裡？」（牠們）說。
#n mggaluk這裡是「溝通」的意思。
#n mggaluk這裡是「溝通」的意思。
#e Ancestors told (them). Since at that time animals and people could communicate, they could understand and speak each other’s language.
#c 先祖們就告訴了（牠們）。因為當時動物和人可以溝通，所以原來就聽得懂也會說語言對方的語言。
#e When animals heard about that, they said, “How unfortunate you are! Tell us how to handle this.”
#c 牠們聽到那樣的事後，牠們說：「你們真不幸啊！你說這樣要怎麼辦？」
#n mk-表示「累積」；mk-piya ali多少日子
#n hari表達「約略」或「究竟」。
#n mk-表示「累積」；mk-piya ali多少日子
#n hari表達「約略」或「究竟」。
#e How far did they walk and where did they arrive? Now, perhaps (they) are arriving at what is called the Pttingan mountain in our Tgdaya language.
#c 他們走了多遠？他們到了哪裡？現在他們可能即將抵達我們?固達雅語中稱作Pttingan山的地方。
#e I do not know how to call it in Truku.
#c 太魯閣語如何稱呼我就不得而知。
#e Our tribespeople came from Truwan and arrived there. And animals and people all gather there.
#c 我們族人從Truwan抵達那裡。動物和人都聚集在那裡。
#n ye kla-an常用於猜測。
#n ye kla-an常用於猜測。
#e Maybe it was almost the evening, or was it in the morning or at noon? I do not know.
#c 可能接近傍晚了，還是早上或中午？我不知道。
#n ckceka「中間」。
#n mp-rengo「對話」。
#n mp-rengo「對話」。
#e Then animals said, “How about…” (They) thought and said that they were all like friends, even though they were human and animals.
#c 動物們說「是這樣做如何..」他們想，他們說他們都是朋友，即使是人和動物。
#n quri seediq「人類」。
#n quri seediq「人類」。
#e “How should we help the human being?” animals discussed this way.
#c 「我們該怎樣幫助人類？」動物這樣討論著。
#n ani si表示「但是」。
#n ani si表示「但是」。
#n mp-rengo對話；p<n>rngag-an討論的結果。
#n mp-rengo對話；p<n>rngag-an討論的結果。
#e There was much discussion afterwards, but the human beings thought none was going to work out and they did not know whether the result would be good.
#c 之後有許多討論，但人類認為沒有可行的，他們也不知道結果好不好。
#e After that, maybe it was thrush who said, “Let’s do this way, shall we?”
#c 之後，好像是繡眼畫眉說：「我們這樣做，好嗎？」
#n kini ho「像這樣」「這樣好嗎」。
#n bungu圓頂，指較低的山。
#n bungu圓頂，指較低的山。

#e Among us, the one who can bring a big stone on Pttingan mountain, the one who is capable of bringing back the stone from the top of the hill to where we are…the one who wins and is capable of moving the stone back here, his words will be your tribal law afterwards.
#c 我們當中有誰能夠去拿在Pttingan山的大石頭，那個有能力從山丘上帶回石頭到我們在的地方的…那個贏的，能夠將石頭搬來這裡的，他的話之後就是你們的族律。

#e It was proposed by some animals. Elderly people said that was thrush. Elderly people who taught me told me this. The elderly people who taught me said so. The late Tiwas and Pawan said to me, “It was thrush who said so.”
#c 有些動物這樣建議。族老是說是繡眼畫眉。教我的老人是這麼說的。已故的Tiwas和Pawan告訴我：「是繡眼畫眉說的。」
#e (Thrush said,) “You Seediq people, because you do not have tribal laws, you are punished by God, your God.” They said.
#c （繡眼畫眉）說：「你們賽德克人，因為你們沒有族律所以你們被神懲罰，你們的神。」他們說。
#e “How to deal with this situation of people?” thrush throught like this.
#c 「人這樣的情況，該怎麼辦才好？」繡眼畫眉這樣想。
#e At that time, ancestors thought, and said, “That is good.”
#c 當時祖先們想著，然後說：「也好。」
#e Afterwards, all the animals took turning going, wanting to move that big stone.
#c 之後，所有的動物輪流前去，想要搬那顆大石頭。
#e And no one could make it.
#c 但沒人做到。
#e No matter which one, even our so-called four-footed animals or the winged birds, they all went but could not make it.
#c 不論是哪個，就算是我們所稱的四隻腳動物，就算是我們所稱有翅膀的鳥類，都去但沒人能做到。
#n gaga這裡為口誤。
#n gaga這裡為口誤。
#e Then, there remained three who did not go and try to move (the stone).
#c 然後，還剩下三個沒去試著搬。
#e Of these three, one was thrush; another was black bulbul; the other was crow.
#c 這三個裡面，一個是繡眼畫眉，一個是紅嘴黑鵯，另一個是烏鴉。
#e Since crow was big, he went first.
#c 由於烏鴉的體型大，所以他先去。
#n plale「蝴蝶」。
#e Crow went to move this stone.
#c 烏鴉去搬這塊石頭。
#e It is said that they once raised the stone, but dropped it.
#c 傳說中說道他們曾將石頭抬起，但又放下。
#n 不確定幾隻烏鴉。
#n inu dungan「還有呢？」
#n inu dungan「還有呢？」
#e What’s more, crow’s foot was hit and he yelled in pain and ran away. He could not make it.
#c 而且，烏鴉的腳被壓到，他慘叫逃走。他沒做到。
#n 牠沒能搬動石頭。
#e That one was finished, which means there remained black bulbul and thrush.
#c 那個結束後，表示剩下紅嘴黑鵯和繡眼畫眉。
#e Black bulbul also tried.
#c 紅嘴黑鵯也去（試看看）。
#e Black bulbul went first. Sisin thought and said, “You first.” Black bulbul said “yes” and went.
#c 紅嘴黑鵯先去。繡眼畫眉想一下，說：「你們先去。」紅嘴黑鵯說「好」然後走了。
#e No matter how hard black bulbul tried, he could not move (the stone).
#c 不論紅嘴黑鵯如何使力都無法搬動。
#n kweko「使盡全力」「想盡辦法」。
#e Then, there remained only sisin who did not go and move.
#c 然後，就只剩繡眼畫眉沒去搬。
#e The late Tiwas said that people at that time were really sad, saying “What can we do with this?”
#c 已故的Tiwas說當時的人很傷心，說：「這樣我們該如何是好？」
#e People thought, “What is such a small bird capable of doing?”
#c 人們想：「這麼小的鳥，有什麼能耐呢？」
#e All the animals as well thought probably no one was capable of taking and carrying that stone.
#c 所有的動物也認為或許沒人能搬移那顆石頭。
#e But thrush did not say anything. He went to that so-called Pttingan mountain.
#c 但繡眼畫眉什麼都沒說。他前去那座所謂的Pttingan山。
#e It was not long before they raised that stone.
#c 沒多久他們抬起那顆石頭。
#e People saw thrush raise that stone. They were frightened and all of suddenly became speechless.
#c 人們看繡眼畫眉抬起那顆石頭。他們受到驚嚇，突然變得鴉雀無聲。
#n asi lux「即刻」；melux「無中生有/無緣故」。
#n so hari ka猶如
#n so hari ka猶如
#e It was like they saw the God. It was also like they were frightened greatly.
#c 就像是見到了神一般，也像是受到極大的驚嚇。
#e Until thrush brought the stone, crossed the river, arrived at the other side, and dropped it where the people gathered.
#c 直到繡眼畫眉提著石頭越過河面，抵達對岸，放在人聚集的那裡。
#e The ground was all shaking, and people were frightened, thinking, “What is that?” Then people came to at that time.
#c 整個地面都在震動，人們驚嚇，心想：「那是什麼？」然後那時候人們才清醒過來。
#n mt-kela「清醒」。
#e People said, “How powerful thrush is!” They are all very happy.
#c 人們說：「這繡眼畫眉怎麼那麼厲害！」他們全都很高興。
#e Thus, from then on, our Seediq people take thrush’s words as tribal law.
#c 所以，從那時候起，我們賽德克人就以繡眼畫眉的話作為族律。
#n 人又說
#n 人又說
#e Afterwards, people say there was another story at that time.
#c 之後，人又說當時有另一個故事。
#e Pawan said a little about this. The late Pawan Nawi told about it.
#c Pawan這個說了一些。已故的Pawan Nawi說的。
#e Here it goes, “There were not really one, but two stones over there,” he told the late Tiwas.
#c 是這樣的：「真的不只是一顆，而是有兩顆石頭在那裡。」他告訴已故的Tiwas。
#e Tiwas said, ‘Oh? Then what happened?’
#c Tiwas說：「喔？然後又怎麼了？」
#n kela naq「原來」。
#n kela naq「原來」。
#n berah有「之前」「先前」的意思。
#n berah有「之前」「先前」的意思。
#e Some animals who failed to (witness them) go to move that big stone for the first time arrived there and asked thrush again, regretting, “Why did we miss it? Why did we miss it?”
#c 有些動物沒趕上（目睹他們）第一次去搬那顆大石頭，到了那邊，又問繡眼畫眉，後悔說：「為什麼我們錯過了？為什麼我們錯過了？」
#e Thus they went and said to thrush, “How about you going again to bring back a huge stone, so that we know it was really you who have brought back this stone?” they said so to thrush.
#c 因此他們去向繡眼畫眉說：「你們再去拿回一顆石頭如何？好讓我們知道這顆石頭是你們搬過來的。」他們跟繡眼畫眉這麼說。
#e Thrush said nothing and left again.
#c 繡眼畫眉不置可否，又去了。
#n knduwa標記需要再確認。
#n knduwa標記需要再確認。
#n hari這裡是「約略」的意思。
#n hari這裡是「約略」的意思。
#n knpruwan na btunux石頭的大小。
#n knpruwan na btunux石頭的大小。
#e Again, thrush brought back another stone of roughly the same size.
#c 繡眼畫眉又帶回一顆約略同大小的石頭。
#e He lifted (the stone), brought it back to the other side, and dropped it down. Then there are now two stones now.
#c 他抬起石頭，帶回另一邊，再放下以後，現在那裡有兩顆石頭了。
#e Pawan said that recently some elderly went there to set traps. When thet passed this stone, they said, “It is necessary that chidren be told this story,” he told me.
#c Pawan說，即使到最近有些老人家到那裡放陷阱，他們經過這個石頭的時候說：「應該要告訴小孩這個故事。」他告訴我。
#n ha表示問句。
#n ha表示問句。
#e After thrush finished moving these two stones, people said to thrush again, “What’s wrong with us Seediq people? Why are we constantly sick? We get all kinds of diseases.”
#c 繡眼畫眉搬完這兩座石頭之後，人們又跟他說：「我們賽德克人是怎麼了？為什麼我們一直生病？我們罹患各種疾病。」
#n meluq「未熟的東西」。
#n meluq「未熟的東西」。
#e “Is this because we eat raw food?” people asked thrush.
#c 「是不是因為我們吃生的食物？」他們問繡眼畫眉。
#e “Well, that would be good,” thrush said and thought.
#c 「嗯，那也好。」繡眼畫眉說，思考著。
#e Then, he called crow and black bulbul to come over.
#c 然後，他叫烏鴉和紅嘴黑鵯過來。
#n ho用來徵求意見。
#n ho用來徵求意見。
#e “What do you say we do this? Can you go find... the supposed source of fire?”
#c 「我們這樣做好嗎？你是否可以去找那個…應該是火的根源？」
#e How to call it now? I do not know, either.
#c 現在怎麼稱呼這個東西？我也不知道。
#e At that time, there was no fire. Our ancestors did not know to eat cooked food.
#c 那個年代還沒有火。我們的祖先還不懂得吃熟食。
#e “Go find the source of fire,” thrush said and dispatched crow and black bulbul.
#c 「去找火源。」繡眼畫眉說，派遣烏鴉和紅嘴黑鵯。
#e Crow and Black bulbul thought of such power thrush had, so they obeyed immediately.
#c 烏鴉和紅嘴黑鵯想到繡眼畫眉那麼的厲害，於是立刻聽話。
#n thei焦點變化：tihiy-un；tihiy-an。
#n sisin為口誤，應為pucaq。
#n sisin為口誤，應為pucaq。
#e Because thrush can move the big stone, black bulbul and crow thought to themselves, he is helped by God. Thus black bulbul and crow obeyed immediately.
#c 因繡眼畫眉能搬移大石頭，紅嘴黑鵯和烏鴉自己想，他是受到神的幫助。因此紅嘴黑鵯和烏鴉立刻答應。
#e Then they went downstream to find the so-called source of fire.
#c 然後他們就往下游去尋找所謂的火源。
#e After a while, (they) came back.
#c 過了一段時間，（他們）回來了。
#n 連腳也紅
#e They saw black bulbul and crow, and black bulbul was in the front. They saw black bulbul’s mouth was reddish, and his feet were reddish, too.
#c 他們看到紅嘴黑鵯和那烏鴉，紅嘴黑鵯在前。他們看到紅嘴黑鵯的嘴巴紅紅的，腳也紅紅的。
#n 連腳也紅
#e All the people and all the animals did not know what that was.
#c 所有的人，所有的動物都不知道那是什麼。
#e And crow was cawing, following at the back of black bulbul.
#c 而烏鴉嘎嘎地叫，追在紅嘴黑鵯之後。
#e They arrived at the place where people gathered and landed on the ground.
#c 他們到達人群聚集之處，飛落到地面。
#n stama「著地」「停留」。
#e This black bulbul dropped the red thing he was biting in his mouth.
#c 這個紅嘴黑鵯就放掉咬在嘴中的紅色之物。
#n mtanah類紅
#n mtanah類紅
#e He dropped that unknown red thing on the ground.
#c 他把那紅色不知道是什麼的東西放落到地上。
#e He also dropped what he grabbed by the feet on the ground.
#c 他也把腳抓的放到地上。
#n d<n>oi手抓。
#e Oh dear! He dropped (it) on the ground. At that time, it was sunny, and all over the ground there were dry grass, which burned immediately.
#c 哎呀！他放落到地上。那時候是晴天，地上都是乾草，馬上燒起來。
#e It burned immediately. ‘What is it?’ people were shocked and ran away.
#c 當時馬上燃燒起來。「這是什麼？」人們受到驚嚇逃開。
#e It burnt and smoked. At that moment, he had dropped and gone aside.
#c 那在燃燒且冒煙，那時候，他放下後就到一邊了。
#e Then that dry grass was burning. “What is it?” people ran away.
#c 然後那乾枯的草在燃燒。「這是什麼？」人們逃開。
#e As the burning stopped, that was not red anymore, It become white.
#c 燃燒結束後，那不再是紅色。它變成白色。
#e It looked like a white stone, a white flint.
#c 看起來像白色的石頭，白燧石。
#e In our language today, maybe it is called white crystal just like the ones that women wear on ears.
#c 以現在我們的話來說，或許稱作白水晶，就像女人戴在耳朵的那種。
#e That stone looked like a white and hard flint.
#c 那石頭看起來像是白色且硬的白晶石。
#e Then someone said, “Where has the fire gone?”
#c 然後有人說：「火跑去哪裡了？」

#e Then, there was one man who went there without saying anything, and picked up those two stones, the two stones that black bulbul had brought back, one he bit in his mouth, and the other he grabbed by his feet.
#c 然後有一個人走到那裡，一聲不響拿起那兩顆石頭，那兩顆紅嘴黑鵯帶回來的石頭，一顆咬在嘴裡，另一顆用腳抓著。
#e He picked (them) up from the ground and then he rubbed (them) against each other.
#c 他從地上撿起撿起，然後將（兩顆燧石）相互擦擊。
#e When knocking, “why there is fire spark?” this man said. “It was like this,” he said.
#c 敲擊時，這個人說：「怎麼有火花？」「原來是這樣啊」他說。
#e Then, this person took dry leaves, knocked the two flint stones against each other, and there were really sparks.
#c 接著這個人拿來了乾葉子，將（兩顆燧石）相互擦擊，真的點出了火花來。
#n knumalu非常好。
#n knumalu非常好。
#e “So it works this way,” people said. People were really happy. “You are really kind,” they said to black bulbul.
#c 「原來是這樣啊，」人們說。人們很開心。「你真的很好，」人們對紅嘴黑鵯說。
#n 摩擦點火，putung可以指「火柴」或「點火」。
#n 摩擦點火，putung可以指「火柴」或「點火」。
#e From then on, our ancestors knew to make fire by rubbing white flints, said our legends inherited from ancestors.
#c 從那時起，我們祖先就會以摩擦燧石取火，祖先流傳下來的故事是這麼說的。
#e Besides, with regard to this black bulbul, now younger people call them Pucaq lmiqu in our language, while elderly people call them Pucaq.
#c 此外，有關這紅嘴黑鵯，現在年輕人以我們族語稱為Pucaq lmiqu，而長者們稱之為Pucaq。
#e Why are his beak and feet red?
#c 何以他的嘴和腳是紅色的呢？
#n rtahuc指還有火的炭/柴。
#n rtahuc指還有火的炭/柴。
#e Because taking the ember to where people were here took a long time.
#c 因為帶餘火到這裡有人的地方要很久。
#e In other words, black bulbul seemed to be burned by the ember, so his mouth and feet are still red now, the elderly said.
#c 也就是說，紅嘴黑鵯似乎是那時候被餘火燒，所以到現在嘴跟腳都是紅的，族老說。
#n 被本族人稱做Pucaq的鳥有兩類，兩者的羽毛都是黑色的。一類在鄉間部落中常見的是黑嘴黑腳者，在鳥類圖鑑中名為黑嘴黑鵯。而本故事中所說的，則屬今日山林間始能見到的紅嘴紅腳者，鳥類圖鑑中名為紅嘴黑鵯。為區分這兩類Pucaq，本族晚輩（包括Dakis）稱山林間的Pucaq為Pucaq lmiqu；lmiqu是「山林、叢林」之意。
#e Then, as for crow, there is one story. I just told you he was hit by the stone and could not move the stone.
#c 那麼，至於烏鴉呢，有一種說法。我剛才告訴你他被石頭壓到，沒辦法搬動石頭。
#e There is another story.
#c 有另一個說法。
#e Black bulbul and crow went to find the source of fire.
#c 紅嘴黑鵯和烏鴉去找火源。
#e Because black bulbul found it first, crow thought, “How can we lose to him again?”
#c 因為紅嘴黑鵯先找到，所以烏鴉想著：「我們怎麼可以又輸給紅嘴黑鵯？」
#e Thus he went to rob black bulbul, but how could you possibly rob black bulbul?
#c 所以烏鴉去搶紅嘴黑鵯，但是你怎能搶得過紅嘴黑鵯呢？
#n inu naq「怎麼可能」「哪裡能夠」。
#e Black bulbul may have made effort to bite and grab, so crow could not take it away.
#c 可能紅嘴黑鵯咬得用力也抓得很用力，所以烏鴉沒辦法拿走。
#n musa lux「無故」。
#n musa lux「無故」。
#e Instead, crow went and got scalded for no reason.
#c 烏鴉反而自己無故讓火源給燙傷。
#n sbbobo「浮動」「搖擺」；bobo「上面」。
#n sbbobo「浮動」「搖擺」；bobo「上面」。
#e Thus, when crow arrived on the ground, because his feet were scalded when he flew above, he swayed when walking even to this day. Our ancestors told the story like this.
#c 因此，當烏鴉到達地面時，因為他的腳在上面飛行的時候被燙傷，所以直到今日走路起來還是搖搖晃晃的。我們的先祖是這麼傳述的。

#e Then, to this day, it is said that the elderly have gone to look for the origin of the source of fire. That is our Tongan tribe now, they said. Black bulbul and crow went there to find a white flint.
#c 然後，到現在據說他們去找過火源的源頭。那是我們現在的Tongan部落，他們說。紅嘴黑鵯和烏鴉去那裡尋找燧石。
#e And even to this day, the place called Tongan, the so-called Tongan this word, its word root is ptung-an.
#c 即使到今天，那被稱做Tongan的地方，所說的Tongan這個字，詞源就是ptung-an（擦擊點火）。
#e People built up a tribe there, and they changed the name into Tongan.
#c 人們在那裡建立部落，然後他們就換稱為Tongan。
#e In fact, Tongan this place, its name was really ptungan.
#c 事實上，Tongan這個地方，他的名字原來真的是ptungan。
#e Was it true? Where is the real place where black bulbul found the nice white flints? I don’t know, either.
#c 這是真的嗎？紅嘴黑鵯找到好的白燧石的地方在哪裡？我也不知道。
#e That’s all. My words end here.
#c 就這樣，我的話說到這裡。
